DarkHawk:

Darkhawk took one  of his Feather missiles and ran towards Tucso=
n and he Used a stunned gun againts Him, then manually starting to transfor=
mn Him to his Robot mode and once he was in his robot mode he tied him thig=
nly. 




From: Sandy 
Sent: Saturday, February 20, 2010 10:19 PM
To: nbwrp=
g@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortress


  
Tucso=
n was hurting on every inch of his body. There was nothing that did not ach=
e or throb. Yet, he makes no groans or expression of his agony. He merely s=
ighs heavilly to try and catch his breath. He came to the realization that =
if he is going to get out of his predicament in one piece he would have to =
try a move that no one would ever dream he would try. But Hydras and the ot=
hers have seemed to have caught onto him, including Zarak. He had already s=
canned him and found his schematics out. Now, they wanted to question him. =
Though battered and dented and in a state of disrepair, the thought of them=
 trying to get him to answer their questions so that they could use him for=
 their own evil gain, that was definitely not going to fly with him.

Throu=
gh all his damages, he finds himself still able to get on his knees to assu=
me a transforming position, and then painfully transforms into his SUV mode=
. 

" You - forgot - something. My - engine - is still - in tact." 

He put=
s himself into drive and screeches his back tires, now daring to make a mov=
e on wheels. Smoke from his duel exhaust system fills the room and even tho=
ugh it was painful to roll his tires, he keeps at it, to try and fill the r=
oom with a bit of a smoke screen. He was adept in these conditions because =
he couldn't see anything anyway. Before moving he makes sure he fills the r=
oom with enough smoke to cloud things a bit. He had to make his move, becau=
se his energy reserves would not last him much longer. His energon level dr=
ops dangerously low, yet he knew that maybe with what little he had left, h=
e could get out of there and hopefully gain a bit of ground away from the t=
ower. He uses his sonar systems to navigate around Rodimus,Scourge and Cycl=
onus, desperately looking for a way out. But at the same time, he picks up =
another familliar signature. Nightlight. He comes to a screeching halt. And=
 now, finds that there is not enough fuel to get himself out of the tower. =
He would have to remain where he was. And in his present SUV mode. 

"N - N=
ight - Nightlight... Here...." 

His engine shuts down. Clearly there was n=
ot enough energy to make his escape, and he had not the heart to leave a co=
mrade behind. No matter if it were a Maximal or an Autobot. His headlights =
dim, as his body now goes off line due to energy exhaustion.

--- In nbwrpg=
@yahoogroups.com, <airly2002@...> wrote:
>
> Hydras:
> 
> Hydras frowned an=
d he without mercy trow awayTucson and started to beat him savagely while w=
ith his multiple heads were bitting him too. Then he Stoped and using his h=
ydra's heads he araised Tucson and trow him in a way that he landed at Scou=
rge's feet and said "You are Right Zarak, we should formally question this =
fellow and find a use for him... after all we will have time to kill him la=
ter... before yourself have your sport; I have a some issues to check, unle=
ss you have a real Emergency i dotn wat to be disturbed.... Scourge, Rodimu=
s... take this patetic bot and be sure that extract every piece of useful i=
nformation from him... I want a report when you finish, then I will decide =
what to do next"
> 
> Hdyras walked away to his chambers. 
> 
> 
> From: Su=
per Cyclonus 
> Sent: Saturday, February 20, 2010 6:24 AM
> To: nbwrpg@yaho=
ogroups.com 
> Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortress
> 
> 
> 
> > H=
ydras:
> > 
> > "Let you go????"said mockly the Predacon leader"
> >
> > Tu=
cson continues to simply go with the flow.
> >
> > "All right, maybe you do=
n't want to let me go. Then, what would you like to do with me? Surely you =
want me to suffer a fate worse than destruction right? I know you would."
>=
 
> "Ahem, um LORD Hydras" Zarak's voice came over the Dark Tower speakers,=
 his voice stumbling over over the word 'lord' and for a moment sounding va=
guely sardonic before he continued. "While you have been um . . . dealing w=
ith our intruder I have been keeping watch over the scanners."
> 
> There i=
s a slight pause as one of the ceiling mounted scanners orients on Tuscon, =
"He does indeed have features that resemble Prime." Zarak's voice speaks ag=
ain, "Before you kill him, he might be useful to us." Zarak's dark chuckle =
rolls through the room, "After all. If not, he can still be put to death."
=
> 
> Preston
> (Temping Zarak/Scorponok)
>
